pull_request.title: Logging Part 2: Inserting messages into a log file

pullrequest.title: Logging Part 2: Inserting messages into a log file

content.raw:
Looking at the tests, I see the following pattern for constructing a `Descriptor`:

* Instantiate a `Descriptor` object.
* Populate a `TopicKeyMap` object.
* Call reset to populate `desc` with `topics`.

Would it be possible to simplify this pattern by offering a `Descriptor` constructor that accepts a `TopicKeyMap` object?

Also, is there any way of directly adding some entries to an existing descriptor without resetting entirely?
content.html:
Looking at the tests, I see the following pattern for constructing a Descriptor:

  • Instantiate a Descriptor object.
  • Populate a TopicKeyMap object.
  • Call reset to populate desc with topics.

Would it be possible to simplify this pattern by offering a Descriptor constructor that accepts a TopicKeyMap object?

Also, is there any way of directly adding some entries to an existing descriptor without resetting entirely?

pull_request.title: Logging Part 2: Inserting messages into a log file

pullrequest.title: Logging Part 2: Inserting messages into a log file

content.raw:
We're trying to keep its use very limited for right now, because it's a big can of worms to spin off a replacement for the `ign-common` console.

At the moment, the only way to change verbosity level will be through the command line tool (although the command line tool won't be introduced until the 8th pull request in this sequence).

By keeping the entire implementation and interface for this feature private, we don't have to worry about maintaining it for users, and we can replace it at any time without worry.
content.html:
We're trying to keep its use very limited for right now, because it's a big can of worms to spin off a replacement for the ign-common console.

At the moment, the only way to change verbosity level will be through the command line tool (although the command line tool won't be introduced until the 8th pull request in this sequence).

By keeping the entire implementation and interface for this feature private, we don't have to worry about maintaining it for users, and we can replace it at any time without worry.

pull_request.title: Logging Part 2: Inserting messages into a log file

pullrequest.title: Logging Part 2: Inserting messages into a log file

content.raw:
I'm okay with that and it would work just fine, but since `Descriptor` is part of the `Log` API, I'd personally prefer to `#include` it in the `Log` header so it's readily available to users who want to get it.

Otherwise users will have to figure out that they need to explicitly include `Descriptor.hh` before they're able to use this `Log` function, and that can be irritating.
content.html:
I'm okay with that and it would work just fine, but since Descriptor is part of the Log API, I'd personally prefer to #include it in the Log header so it's readily available to users who want to get it.

Otherwise users will have to figure out that they need to explicitly include Descriptor.hh before they're able to use this Log function, and that can be irritating.
